dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandon hurries from the house, looks around and lights a cigarette. He catches something out of the corner of his eye. He freezes. John and Ray are leaning against the car smoking, waiting. He bolts back towards Lana. A house lig comes on. John and Ray chase him down. He struggles. John and Ray violently force him into the car.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Get in. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  105.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Get out of the car. Get out of tha car. Brandon gets out. John looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON

dialogues.text: Go ahead, man. Take it. Ray lifts Brandon up, grabs his face, and kisses him. Bra pushes him off. John pushes Ray back. Brandon tries to pull up his jeans, but Ray pushes him up against the car rapes him. Brandon loses himself in the white light of th headlights. Reflected in his pupil, the light fills scree

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ray's driving. Brandon sits between John and Ray.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Now if you keep our little secret, we’re gonna stay friends right?...

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Just take me home ok?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (very reasonable) And if you don’t, I’1l have to silence you permanently. Right?

INT - RAY'S HOUSE ~ BATHROOM/ LIVING ROOM - DAWN is Brandon peels off the clothes he was raped in, gets in th shower. Blood slides down his skin into the drain.

dialogues.text: You OK in there little dude?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm fine. Quick flash of Brandon in the car between John and Ray sa

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course, this whole thing is my fault. CUT BACK TO SHOWER. Water on Brandon’s body. He’s crying. He slugs himself again and again in the thigh

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: (intensely to himself) Fuck! Fuck! Fuck fuck (grabs his hair, pulls it) Shit! Shower still running, Brandon gets out shaking with rage pain. The door is ajar. He peeks out. He sees John laying on the sofa smoking a joint. He can't see Ray. He moves back, against the wall, out of John's sight and dresses quickly.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN TO RAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She's getting ready. Right?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: {trying to get control) Yep, be right out. He reaches back into the shower, and struggles to open th window, his clothes getting wetter and wetter. The window pops, he climbs up and forces himself out.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: (like he's joking) Ray, relax, man, give me two fucking seconds. EXT - RAY’S - WINDOW: STREETS - DAWN 1 Pink/yellow light. Brandon falls from the window to the lawn. He runs. Brandon runs and runs through the small town streets. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  108.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Brandon, with no shoes, falls against the door frame, lea against the buzzer. The door opens. Lana squints into the light.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Brandon. Brandon collapses into Lana’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Lana leans down, talks. Brandon hears cars on the highway

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: (distorted) Mom--get in here. Lana pulls her bloody hand to herself, extends it to MOM' skirt hem. Mom shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: (anger, shock) What are you doing here? Brandon sees her contempt. His gaze moves down her skirt and moves to the picture window and TV are out of focus.

dialogues.speaker: LANA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mom stop it. He’s hurt.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I don't want it in my house.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: Call an ambulance! Now! Now!

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Corridor lights overhead. Brandon is rolled on a gurney.

dialogues.speaker: FALLS CITY HOSPITAL ROOM
dialogues.text: Rape sounds filter in. Brandon sits on the table, his shi off.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: So they assaulted you? Nurse cuts Brandon’s bloody ace bandage off. He nods. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: If you don’t mind, it's just necessary for you to take your pants off. Brandon just stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Please I’m not gonna hurt you. She reaches for his pants. Brandon pulls away and cries.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: How did you know they raped me?

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Brandon at a phone talks to his mom.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: (tears in his eyes) God, your voice sounds so good.

dialogues.speaker: JOANN
dialogues.text: Teena what’s wrong? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: (long pause) Mom, its something really bad...

dialogues.speaker: JOANN
dialogues.text: (frightened) Teena, are you hurt?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Mom, they, they did it to me. I didn’t cry...Mom can I come home?

dialogues.speaker: JOANN
dialogues.text: Teena, go to the police.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: (looks up frustrated) The police, are you kidding?

dialogues.speaker: JOANN
dialogues.text: Honey, go to the police. They'll help you. They'll help you get home.

dialogues.speaker: OK
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  110.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Mom, can’t you come get me, please?

dialogues.speaker: JOANN
dialogues.text: Please. Joann closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Kate, Lana and Mom fill out their testimonies.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Just write everything you know from last night, don’t leave anything out. Brandon stands, shaky. Brian steadies him, takes him down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Easy bud. You ok? 163 INT - SHERIFF’S DEPT. - INTERVIEW ROOM - DAY - MOMENT A tape recorder's on. Brian, Brandon and SHERIFF LAUX.

dialogues.speaker: LAUX
dialogues.text: Is it true you run around with a sock in your underpants trying to act like a hoy? Brandon sits there, unable to answer.

dialogues.speaker: LAUX
dialogues.text: I’m asking you this because if this goes to court that question is going to come up and I’m going to want an answer. (Silence) Alright. Let’s back up. After he pulled your pants down and seen you was a girl. Laux paces. Brandon stares at the recorder. 164 INT - BRANDON'S TRAILER - DAY (PAST) 16. A YOUNG TEENA, age 8, plays air guitar in her mock band t SEXPODS. Joann and her boyfriend at the time watch.

dialogues.speaker: LAUX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Did he fondle you any? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Joann, Tammy and Teena (age 5) dressed in Easter White wa toward the church. Teena hesitates, pulls away, fidgets i her dress, then starts to tug at it. She looks back as th something calls her. Joann returns, and leads her back.

dialogues.speaker: LAUX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Didn't fondle you any? Huh? Didn't that kinda amaze you, after he pulled your pants down and been wanting to take you to bed - and you told him no that you was a boy and couldn’t do that.

dialogues.text: Brian finally walks out. Brandon comes back from flashbac

dialogues.speaker: LAUX

dialogues.text: (weaker) I don't know what he did.

dialogues.text: I can't believe he pulled your pants down and you are a female he didn't stick his hand in you, or his finger in you.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: (absolute frustration) Well he didn't.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told Brandon "Nobody has a right to do that to you." (grabs Lana) Lana, we need to go. Now. Lana still won’t go.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lana, everything Teena ever told us was lies. Everything. EVERYTHING. Lana looks to the interview room, then gives in. They lea

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: (shakes head, whispers) You know what? Fuck all you mother fuckers. EXT - CANDACE’S FARMHOUSE PORCH - DAY 1 Brandon looks through the screen door. The TV’s on. He knocks softly. No answer. He knocks again. Finally, Canda appears. Brandon turns away.

dialogues.text: Brandon, I got a kid, I can’t have this. You can’t come in here. He backs up. She moves closer, so she can see him.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE, (CONT'D)

He stands mesmerized by the wall of fla

dialogues.text: You got a pretty big fire there. Brandon cries. Candace holds hin. 176 INT - RAY’S TRAILER - NIGHT - LATER

dialogues.text: I gotta see Lana.

dialogues.text: This ain’t about Lana. Ray looks at him. John seems unsure. He pulls away. phone rings. Ray goes for it. Jobn intercepts hin.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN ,
dialogues.text: Hello? Yeah, hello Sheriff Laux. Yes sir. 177 INT - SHERIFF'S DEPT. - INTERVIEW ROOM -— MORNING 116. 176 The 177 Tape recorder on. Ray watches it, then motions that Brian turn off the recorder. Brian does.

dialogues.text: Ok, I'll tell you what happened, but not on tape. TI didn't have sex with her, Keith did. if I tell you the rest will you keep me outta jail?

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ray walks swiftly down the hall. John, looking like he's falling apart, rises. Dave, holding testimonials in his hand, laughs with another deputy, while looking at John.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Linda says they “butt-fucked" her, I mean "him." One really weird thing about the guys who did it, since they were kind of doing it to a guy, are they, you know, like that? He flips his wrist and laughs. John doesn’t laugh. Ray starts to but stops. John looks to Ray and signals he fol They walk down the hall and whisper.

dialogues.text: Did you say anything?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: No, did you? John studies Ray.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Look, they’re gonna talk to her again. So we gotta do something. John looks at him, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Well, Ray's willing to roll, and we got P.C. to arrest em. I wanna make a dispatch before dark.

dialogues.speaker: LAUX
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you ain't gonna arrest them. Not yet. I got some more questions for Teena. Brian goes to argue. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  118.

dialogues.text: John drinks from a bottle, turns away and locks at a pict atop the TV, of him and Lana as teenagers. Kate enters. H looks at her, then to the picture.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I remember the night you guys took that. He opens a drawer and removes a knife, "LOTTER" on the sh

dialogues.text: What are you gonna do? He handles the knife nervously, grabs two pair of yellow workman's gloves and the car keys. He looks to Kate, upse

dialogues.text: John, if you do that, that's the end of it.

dialogues.text: (upset) I ain't going back in the joint. I warned. It didn't listen.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: John you fucker, I know you’re stupid, but you’re not that stupid. He pushes past. Kate watches. John passes his mom, meets Ray, and tosses him the keys. They get in. Ray drives.

dialogues.text: Ray and John appear in the shadow, staggering, drunk.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: (to John, quiet) John, man, if anyone else is there, . you’re gonna have to take care of * them. They come out of the dark. John has a gun. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We wanna hang out with you and Brandon.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: I ain't seen Brandon since you seen him. Ray returns. Through the screen door, Candace watches the stumble away. She turns and pours herself a drink. 182 INT ~ CANDACE'S BARN - NIGHT 1s Brandon, appearing more feminine, watches the full moon o the horizon, then closes his eyes. The screen goes dark. He turns. In the shadow, as if from a dream, a woman appears. It’s Lana. Brandon smiles and opens his eyes. Lana stands near him. He shuts his eyes again, slowly reopens them.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: Can I come sit by you? Brandon nods. Lana sits on the bed. Awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: Do you hate me? Brandon shakes his head "no," takes Lana’s hand, then let go. Lana stares off nervous, then takes Brandon’s hand, lies next to him and kisses hin.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: You need anything? Brandon shakes his head "no," pulls Lana closer. 183 INT - CANDACE’S BARN - NIGHT 1 Time has passed. Brandon and Lana lie together. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  120.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: You are so pretty. Embarrassed, Brandon shakes his head "no way."

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: You’re just saying that cuz you like me.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: What were you like? Before all this? Were you like me? Like a girl-girl?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Yeah, like a long time ago. Then I guess I was like a boy-girl, then I was just a jerk. FLASHBACK - SKATE WORLD - Brandon and Heather reflected i the discoball that spins over the teens.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (lost in the memory) It was weird, finally, everything felt right. Brandon turns and sees Lana looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: What? Pretty crazy huh?

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: Yep... Lana leans in and kisses Brandon on the lips. He’s stunne

dialogues.text: That dream I had...the first night. We were on the highway together. For an instant, Brandon recalls his dream.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: We can still do it...

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: (nervous and fast) Lana - I...look. I’ve never been on the highway, or to the Grand Canyon, or anywhere like that. Until I came here - I never even been out of Lincoln. My sister isn’t a model...in Hollywood. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: She makes phone jacks for AT&T. Heather and I were never engaged. I never even met my Dad and I never~ Lana kisses him. Brandon tentatively kisses her. Lana sto

dialogues.text: I’m kinda scared... you know. I’m not sure I’m gonna know how to do it.

dialogues.text: {laughs, nervous, relieved) I think you’1l figure it out. Lana kisses Brandon. Their hands interlock. Brandon feels the ring. Lana smiles and slips it off. Brandon stops.

dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: (a beat) You know I never been with a girl, like that.

dialogues.speaker: LANA

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: (relieved, nervous) I think I will. She smiles, he smiles. The passion between them builds. Lana’s scared, but she kisses down Brandon’s body. Brando lets her.

dialogues.speaker: A FLASH OF THE CHROMAKEY HIGHWAY 1
dialogues.text: Lana and Brandon walk and disappear into the night. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  122.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Brandon watches Lana sleep. lana awakens. She covers her face. He smiles, calmer, now. She smiles too.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: I...was wondering. Would you come home to Lincoln with me? I got a court date, on the 5th actually, well then a few other things, but then after that, I think things are gonna be good...and I know my mom would love you. Lana just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: It's OK if you don’t want to.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: No, I wanna go with you.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: We’1l need to go tonight, but Candace Said she'll drive us. They get up and gather their stuff. Distant sounds of the highway. He gets up. He watches her waik into the night.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Clock reads 11:00 p.m. Lana's smoking, packing furiously, trying to decide what to take. A knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (through the door) Lana, Rikki Lake’s on.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: {answering to door) I'm laying down, I'll be out ina bit. Lana finishes a note to Mom "I'll miss you most of anyone Signs, "All my love forever, Lana," then resumes packing. Brandon, wearing the Chicago White Sox Jacket, appears at the window, beautiful, his hair no longer slicked back. H has a soft effeminate quality. He slips in. Lana smiles nervously. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  123.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: I know I'm early, but I got the moped. We can just leave right now. It's better. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Don’t pack too much. We’1l send for it later. Tomorrow morning, we’1l have breakfast in Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: What did you do to your hair?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: I don’t know, you like it?

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: I guess so. Brandon looks at her - a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: I can put it back. He takes out his comb, goes to the mirror, and slicks it back like Brandon. He stops. It's awkward. He sees she’s looking around the room at her things: the cow radio, a picture of her and her mom.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: We should go. Brandon goes to kiss her on the lips. She hesitates. Sens her confusion and fear, he kisses her on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: It's okay Lana, you don't have to come with me now. There'll be time. Just get out, OK. Brandon and Lana hear voices. Lana motions that he wait. She slips out and he goes to the door to listen.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: John's in the kitchen, wearing the gloves, fidgeting with them. Mom sees as he hides the gun behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: John ~- what are you doing here? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  124.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Where are they? In her room?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Brandon ain't here.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Where is he? Terrified, Lana stands motionless in the hallway. She hea a sound in her bedroom. Her eyes dart towards her door, then to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I don’t know, but he ain’t here.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Is Lana? John steps toward the hall.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: (scared) Brandon is staying out to Candace's place. John and Mom look at each other. John smiles, but Mom loo away. Lana, in the hall, quickly ducks back into

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Brandon is gone. The window is open. Lana climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: John walks out the door and onto the porch where Ray has been waiting. They walk off. Mom comes to the doorway and watches, then closes the door and locks it. Through the window: we see her turn on the TV, sit down and watch. Lana runs to arrive ahead of John and Ray at their car.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: (casual) What are you guys doing? John looks at her, suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: Wanna go for a drink? Look, I know, I been a jerk, lately. I/’11 buy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  125.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ray shakes his head "no." Lana looks at John. From the dark, a hand touches Lana’s shoulder. She turns to see Ka

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Lana, come with me. Please.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: No! What’s goin' on here? John? John looks from Kate to Lana. Ray opens the door, gets in

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Let’s go! Lana grabs John.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: I’m coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No Lana!

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: Get off me! She pushes Kate back. John looks at Lana. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Okay, darling. He opens the door. She gets in. They get in. They drive off.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Dust like in Brandon’s dream. Car lights illuminate Brand on his moped, at the entrance ramp. For a moment, there a no cars. He rides onto the highway, loses himself in the blackness. He’s all alone. He stops and turns back. 191 INT - JOHN'S MOM'S CAR —- TRAVELLING - NIGHT 1 Lana’s in back. John has the gloves on. Ray sees a deputy sheriff's car, slows.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: Where’ re you going?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Stay off the main street. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  126.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: (sinister) Think they'd still recognize her if we chopped her head AND her hands off?

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: John! John has a gun. He grabs Lana by the neck, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We’re just taking care of a couple a dykes. Are you one a them? Lana just stares at hin.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Still planning on going to Memphis?

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Brandon leans the moped against the porch. He’s about to take it to the back, when a figure appears on the porch, handsome cowboy - Brandon's father. He smiles at Brandon.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: So, are you ready? He puts his hand out to him. Brandon takes it, then stops

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Not yet. His dad kisses his forehead, walks right into Brandon, th walks off alone disappearing into the moonlit silvery fie

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Brandon sits down, and notices something lying on the gro Lana’s ring. He picks it up, smiles, then he puts it in h pocket. His gaze travels out the window, across the field to car lights on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: John and Ray park. John takes the knife from his boot and hands it to Ray. Ray holds the knife under his coat. John holds the gun.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: What’ re we doing here? What’re you gonna do something to Candace? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  127. pe 194 CONTINUED: 1s

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: She’s got a baby, John! Lana hits him. They get out and move towards the farmhous SLO MO: Lana looks to the barn, tries to hold them back. Their moving feet. Lana sees the moped off to the side. REAL TIME.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: John, look at me! John! John marches on. They make it to the rickety door.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: (screams) Candace! Candace! 195 INT/EXT - CANDACE'S BARN - NIGHT 1s INTERCUT WITH PREVIOUS SCENE. Sounds return. Brandon grows scared, distinguishes the so turns for the door and walks out. ~ 196 INT - CANDACE'S FARMHOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 1s John kicks the door in. They enter, and look for a light.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Get outta here. John grabs Lana and pushes her back. She falls.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: No! (calling out) Brandon, Brandon. John, and Ray face the bedroom. Brandon appears in the ba doorway, looking girlish, but strong, calm, assured.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: (direct and calm) Don't hurt Candace. She’s got nothing to do with this. John. You don’t have to do this. For a moment John listens, comprehending.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: (gently, almost kindly) You were right about me John. I just keep getting back up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  128.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: SHUT UP. Don’t listen to her. Brandon looks at Lana, trying to make sense of why she’s there.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: Teena, why didn’t you leave? Brandon smiles at her. She looks at him. For a moment, it's as if the two of them are all alone.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: We can still go. John fires at Brandon. Brandon starts to fall, Ray yanks him up, pulls out a knife and stabs him. Candace appears the door. A gun blast, Candace falls. John throws the gun Lana runs to Brandon's body. Ray grabs the gun and raises it to shoot Lana. John knocks it from him.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Come on. Lana. Lana! John goes to her. Lana is in another world. Ray grabs Joh They go.

dialogues.speaker: LANA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: It's cold, the lights have been shot out.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Light pours in. Lana comes to, sees the dead bodies, the baby watching. She recalls the night and grows terrified. A hand gently touches her hair. She looks up and sees her mom.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: (whispering gently) Come on baby. Everything’s gonna be OK. Lana pulls a letter from Brandon's pocket. Lana's mom gra Lana’s sweater from the floor and helps her up.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Things are gonna go back to the way they were before. Lana opens the letter, and reads as her mom leads her out (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  197 198 199 200 129.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Dear mom, if you’ re wondering where I am, you can quit guessing, I am in the Falls City county jail... Reveal the baby looking at the bodies.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Candace's mom picks up the baby. She momentarily register the murder scene, then takes him out.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I am so tired of running from my problems.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: (letter continued) Changes I'm going though in my life will change me forever. Reveal, this is a busy crime discovery scene. A police photographer snaps photos. EMTs cover the body, carry it a stretcher past the overturned lamp, through the kicked- door frame, down the farmhouse steps, past a deputy stret crime scene tape around the house, down to the lawn where ambulance’s doors swing open. EMTs load the body in. A LINCOLN NEWSCASTER reports.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: (speaking into mike) Reporting live from this isolated farmhouse. (Report trails off) Superimpose a NEBRASKA MAP: Falls City, Lincoln - HEADLIN Falls City, Lincoln Journal “TRAILER PARK ROMEO SLAIN.”

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: This is a TV cast. Joann, Tammy and Joann’s boyfriend dre in black, watch. A knock at the door. Lonny answers it. THE DOOR OPENS - It is Lana. She and Lonny look at each other. She hands Lonny Brandon’s letter. Lonny opens it and reads.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON, (V.0-)
dialogues.text: (letter cont'd) Lana waits on the porch, looking out across the trailer park. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  130.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Something silver glints in the light. Lana sees it’s a beautiful silver Air Stream trailer just as Brandon described it to her. Lana steps a bit closer and smiles. She looks to the highway... FADE TO WHITE: BEAUTIFUL FAST GUITAR SOLO OF MINUTEMEN's: Little Man with a Gun in His Hand over End Titles and Epilogue. Script provided for educational purposes.
